meanings.definition: A book in which the records of money received and paid out are kept.
meanings.sent1: I always keep my cashbook updated to track my expenses.
meanings.sent2: The accountant diligently maintained the cashbook for the company.
meanings.sent3: When the cashbook went missing, chaos ensued in the financial department.
meanings.sent4: The cashbook is like a treasure map, guiding us through our financial journey.
meanings.sent5: The worn-out cashbook held the secrets of the company's financial transactions.

meanings.sent1: I need to cashbook all the transactions from today.
meanings.sent2: She carefully cashbooks every penny that comes in and goes out.
meanings.sent3: If you forget to cashbook, you might lose track of your finances.
meanings.sent4: He cashbooks with precision, ensuring no errors in the financial records.
meanings.sent5: Cashbooking regularly helps in maintaining a clear financial picture.
